cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande, or 275 miles ENE of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast through tonight, then forecast to slow, turn west, and drift toward the middle–upper Texas coast with eventual inland drift toward the Houston/Galveston area early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle to upper Texas coast (likely between Matagorda Bay and Galveston Island)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coastline from the Rio Grande to Sabine Pass, including the Houston/Galveston corridor
weather_observation.wind: Gradual increase to tropical-storm strength (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Monday–Tuesday at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation above ground possible along Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel with persistent onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain bands could produce 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, creating flash-flood risk for port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high seas impacting vessel traffic; potential minor coastal flooding during high tides.
